review: The iPad app is clunky and slow.  Sometimes the iPad connects to Chromecast, sometimes it doesn't.  Same goes for the Chromecast itself.  Every time I use it, it is a roll of the dice as to whether or not it is going to connect to the internet.  I'm kind of shocked and disappointed in the unreliability of this, but I guess for $35, what do you expect?

review: Chromecast takes care of a problem we had...our TV & Home Entertainment System is not Wi-Fi, and our cable modem is rooms away from where the big high-def TV is, and running a cable 100 feet was not an option.  With Chromecast, we can now enjoy streaming with Netflix, Google Play, HBO Go, and a few others.  It was easy to install, set-up and operate.  (we both have android smartphones)  I guess we could even take it on vacation with us for a rainy day or night, as it is very small & convenient to pack-up, as long as we have Wi-Fi & a TV with an HDMI port.  Chromecast works well for me!

review: It did exactly what I need it to do. Cast my Netflix, Youtube and even my google Chrome desktop on my TV. If you don't have a SMART TV, this would be a nice addition to have. review: Streaming from my tablet and computer have been incredibly easy.  Once the device is plugged in, you use a supported app and can send it from your tablet to the chromecast through your wifi connection.  The picture is clear and in HD.A few warnings- if your wifi connection is slow and you normally have lags in viewing films on your tablet/pc, you will have the same lags in the chromecast.  It's not the fault of your chromecast, it's your wifi.  Second- It does use your battery a bit to watch/stream the video, so plug in while you are streaming.
